creditline: Gift of Louis W. Hill, Jr.
department: Chinese, South and Southeast Asian Art
description: Vase Yueh Yao ware; bulbous body with slender neck and wide mouth; lotus design incised on grey and buff glaze; stoneware; described as 'stoneware with grayish green glaze'
medium:
Yue ware
Stoneware with incised decor under a celadon glaze
text: The chui-hu is one of the most prevalent vessel shapes of the Six Dynasties period. This one is decorated with six large lotus petals suggesting possible Buddhist symbolism. Celadon wares with similar ornament have been executed from ancient kiln sites in Chekiang province.
title: Bottle Vase (chui-hu)
